title: Abundius and Abundantius
text:
Abundius and Abundantius (died c. 304) are <a href="Christianity">Christian</a> <a href="martyr">martyr</a>s who were killed during the <a href="Diocletian%20persecution">Diocletian persecution</a>. Their <a href="feast%20day">feast day</a> is celebrated on September 16.
Biography.
Abundius was a <a href="priest">priest</a> who had earlier <a href="resurrect">resurrect</a>ed <a href="John%20and%20Marcianus">John, the son of Marcianus</a>. Upon hearing of this, the emperor ordered these three, with Abundantius, a deacon, to be <a href="decapitation">beheaded</a>. The executions were carried out at the 26th <a href="milestone">milestone</a> of the <a href="Via%20Flaminia">Via Flaminia</a>.
Veneration.
Their bodies were later transferred to the church of <a href="Cosmas%20and%20Damian">Cosmas and Damian</a> in Rome. The bodies of <a href="John%20and%20Marcianus">Marcianus and John</a> were found around 1001 and transferred to <a href="Civita%20Castellana">Civita Castellana</a>. There, they were elected to be the city's principal <a href="patron%20saints">patron saints</a>. In 1583, the relics of Abundius and Abundantius were transferred to the SS. Nome di Gesu, where they were placed under the church's <a href="altar">high altar</a>. <a href="Aloysius%20Gonzaga">Aloysius Gonzaga</a> heard <a href="mass%20%28liturgy%29">mass</a> there before becoming a <a href="Jesuit">Jesuit</a>.
